Package io.dimeformat

Class Item

java.lang.Object
io.dimeformat.Item
Direct Known Subclasses:
Data, Envelope, Identity, IdentityIssuingRequest, Key, Tag
public abstract class Item extends Object
Base class for any other type of Di:ME items that can be included inside an Envelope instance.

    • Item

      public Item()

  • Method Details

    • getHeader

      public abstract String getHeader()
      Returns the item header of the DiME item. This can be used to identify the type of DiME item held in this generic class. It is also used in the exported DiME format to indicate the beginning of a DiME item inside an envelope. Typically, this is represented by a short series of letters.
      Returns:
      The item header of the DiME item.

    • isSigned

      public boolean isSigned()
      Checks if the item has been signed or not.
      Returns:
      true or false.

    • getSignatures

      public List<Signature> getSignatures()
      Returns a read-only list of all attached signatures, null if no signatures are attached.
      Returns:
      Any attached signatures as a read-only list.

    • getClaims

      public Map<Claim,​Object> getClaims()
      Returns all set claims and values.
      Returns:
      A Map with all set claims and values.

    • getClaim

      public <T> T getClaim​(Claim claim)
      Gets an item claim. Will throw IllegalArgumentException if claim requested is not support by the item type.
      Type Parameters:
      T - Using generics.
      Parameters:
      claim - The claim to get the value for.
      Returns:
      The claim value.

    • putClaim

      public void putClaim​(Claim claim, Object value)
      Puts a value to an item claim. Will throw IllegalStateException is the item is already signed.
      Parameters:
      claim - The claim to put a value to.
      value - The claim value.

    • removeClaim

      public void removeClaim​(Claim claim)
      Will remove the value from an item claim.
      Parameters:
      claim - The claim to remove the value from.

    • importFromEncoded

      public static <T extends Item> T importFromEncoded​(String encoded) throws InvalidFormatException
      Will import an item from a DiME encoded string. DiME envelopes cannot be imported using this method, for envelopes use Envelope.importFromEncoded(String) instead.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The subclass of item of the imported DiME item.
      Parameters:
      encoded - The DiME encoded string to import an item from.
      Returns:
      The imported Di:ME item.
      Throws:
      InvalidFormatException - If the encoded string is of a DiME envelope.

    • exportToEncoded

      public String exportToEncoded()
      Exports the item to a DiME encoded string.
      Returns:
      The Di:ME encoded representation of the item.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • rawEncoded

      public byte[] rawEncoded​(boolean withSignatures)
      This will return the encoded item as a byte-array. This should only be used when needing a raw version of the item for cryptographic operations. For distribution and storage exportToEncoded() should be used.
      Parameters:
      withSignatures - Indicates if returned byte-array should contain any attached signatures.
      Returns:
      The item as a byte-array.

    • hasAmbit

      public boolean hasAmbit​(String ambit)
      Will check if an item is within a particular ambit.
      Parameters:
      ambit - The ambit to check for.
      Returns:
      true or false.

    • sign

      public void sign​(Key signingKey) throws CryptographyException
      Will sign an item with the proved key. The Key instance must contain a secret key and be of type IDENTITY.
      Parameters:
      signingKey - The key to sign the item with, must be of type IDENTITY.
      Throws:
      CryptographyException - If something goes wrong.

    • strip

      public boolean strip()
      Will remove all signatures from an item.
      Returns:
      True if the item was stripped of signatures, false otherwise.

    • strip

      public boolean strip​(Key key)
      Will remove the signature created by the provided key, if one can be found.
      Parameters:
      key - The key that created the signature to be removed.
      Returns:
      True if the item was stripped of a signature, false otherwise.

    • generateThumbprint

      public String generateThumbprint() throws CryptographyException
      Returns the thumbprint of the item. This may be used to easily identify an item or detect if an item has been changed. This is created by securely hashing the item and will be unique and change as soon as any content changes. Any signatures attached to the item will be included in the generation of the thumbprint. The encoded format of the returned string is determined by the default cryptographic suite.
      Returns:
      The hash (thumbprint) of the item as an encoded string.
      Throws:
      CryptographyException - If something goes wrong.

    • generateThumbprint

      public String generateThumbprint​(boolean includeSignatures) throws CryptographyException
      Returns the thumbprint of the item. This may be used to easily identify an item or detect if an item has been changed. This is created by securely hashing the item and will be unique and change as soon as any content changes. The encoded format of the returned string is determined by the default cryptographic suite.
      Parameters:
      includeSignatures - If attached signatures should be included when generating the thumbprint.
      Returns:
      The hash (thumbprint) of the item as an encoded string.
      Throws:
      CryptographyException - If something goes wrong.

    • generateThumbprint

      public String generateThumbprint​(boolean includeSignatures, String suiteName) throws CryptographyException
      Returns the thumbprint of the item. This may be used to easily identify an item or detect if an item has been changed. This is created by securely hashing the item and will be unique and change as soon as any content changes. The encoded format of the returned string is determined by the cryptographic suite specified.
      Parameters:
      includeSignatures - If attached signatures should be included when generating the thumbprint.
      suiteName - The name of the cryptographic suite to use, may be null.
      Returns:
      The hash (thumbprint) of the item as an encoded string.
      Throws:
      CryptographyException - If something goes wrong.

    • thumbprint

      public static String thumbprint​(String encoded) throws CryptographyException
      Returns the thumbprint of a DiME encoded item string. This may be used to easily identify an item or detect if an item has been changed. This is created by securely hashing the item and will be unique and change as soon as any content changes. This will generate the same value as the instance method thumbprint for the same (and unchanged) item. The encoded format of the returned string is determined by the default cryptographic suite.
      Parameters:
      encoded - The DiME encoded item string.
      Returns:
      The hash of the item as a hex string.
      Throws:
      CryptographyException - If something goes wrong.

    • thumbprint

      public static String thumbprint​(String encoded, String suiteName) throws CryptographyException
      Returns the thumbprint of a DiME encoded item string. This may be used to easily identify an item or detect if an item has been changed. This is created by securely hashing the item and will be unique and change as soon as any content changes. This will generate the same value as the instance method thumbprint for the same (and unchanged) item. If no cryptographic suite name is provided, then the suite set as default will be used. The encoded format of the returned string is determined by the cryptographic suite specified.
      Parameters:
      encoded - The DiME encoded item string.
      suiteName - The name of the cryptographic suite to use, may be null.
      Returns:
      The hash of the item as a hex string.
      Throws:
      CryptographyException - If something goes wrong.

    • verify

      public IntegrityState verify​(Identity issuingIdentity)
      Verifies the integrity and over all validity and trust of the item. The verification will be made using the public key in the provided identity. The verification will also check if the item has been issued by the provided identity, if the "iss" claim has been set.
      Parameters:
      issuingIdentity - The issuing identity to use when verifying.
      Returns:
      The integrity state of the verification.

    • verify

      public IntegrityState verify​(Identity trustedIdentity, List<Item> linkedItems)
      Verifies the integrity and over all validity and trust of the item. The verification will be made using the public key in the provided identity. The verification will also check if the item has been issued by the provided identity, if the "iss" claim has been set.
      Parameters:
      trustedIdentity - A trusted identity to verify with.
      linkedItems - A list of item where item links should be verified, may be null.
      Returns:
      The integrity state of the verification.

    • verify

      public IntegrityState verify()
      Verifies the integrity and over all validity and trust of the item. Keys used for verification will be fetched from the local key ring.
      Returns:
      The integrity state of the verification.

    • verify

      public IntegrityState verify​(Key verifyKey)
      Verifies the integrity and over all validity and trust of the item. If a key is provided, then verification will use that key. If verifyKey is omitted, then the local key ring will be used to verify signatures of the item.
      Parameters:
      verifyKey - Key used to verify the item, may be null.
      Returns:
      The integrity state of the verification.

    • verify

      public IntegrityState verify​(Key verifyKey, List<Item> linkedItems)
      Verifies the integrity and over all validity and trust of the item. If a key is provided, then verification will use that key. If verifyKey is omitted, then the local key ring will be used to verify signatures of the item.
      Parameters:
      verifyKey - Key used to verify the item, may be null.
      linkedItems - A list of item where item links should be verified, may be null.
      Returns:
      The integrity state of the verification.

    • verifyDates

      public IntegrityState verifyDates()
      Verifies any dates in the item. This will verify the validity period of the item, if it should be used or if it has expired. Failure here does not necessary mean that the item cannot be trusted, the dates of item is no longer valid, refer to the returned state.
      Returns:
      The integrity state of the verification.

    • verifySignature

      public IntegrityState verifySignature​(Key verifyKey)
      Verifies signatures of the item. The method will try to match an associated signature of the item to the provided key. If no key is provided, then the local key ring will be used to verify the item.
      Parameters:
      verifyKey - The key to use for verification, may be null.
      Returns:
      The integrity state of the verification.

    • verifyLinkedItems

      public IntegrityState verifyLinkedItems​(List<Item> linkedItems)
      Verifies any linked items to the item. This method will only verify that the list of provided items matches the links in the item. The signature of the item will not be verified.
      Parameters:
      linkedItems - A list of item where item links should be verified.
      Returns:
      The integrity state of the verification.

    • addItemLink

      public void addItemLink​(Item item)
      Will cryptographically link an item link from provided item to this item.
      Parameters:
      item - The item to link to the tag.

    • setItemLinks

      public void setItemLinks​(List<Item> items)
      Will cryptographically link item links of provided items to this item.
      Parameters:
      items - The items to link.

    • getItemLinks

      public List<ItemLink> getItemLinks()
      Returns a list of item links.
      Returns:
      A list of ItemLink instances, null if there are no links.

    • removeLinkItems

      public void removeLinkItems()
      Removes all item links.

    • convertToLegacy

      @Deprecated public void convertToLegacy()
      Deprecated.
      Legacy support will be removed in the next version.
      Converts the item to legacy (before official Dime version 1).

    • isLegacy

      @Deprecated public boolean isLegacy()
      Deprecated.
      Legacy support will be removed in the next version.
      Checks if the item is legacy (before official Dime version 1).
      Returns:
      True if legacy, false is not.
